title: Life Cycle - Poems
description: Life cycle: the series of developmental stages and changes which comprise the entire life history of a given organism or culture, from inception through maturity and reproductive viability.“Dena Rash Guzman howls coyote howls. There is holiness in her soup. You're cold and hungry right now and you don't even know it. Come inside. Get warm.”  -Scott McClanahan, author of Crapalachia“With the sparseness and wink found in Han Shan (Cold Mountain Poems), Life Cycle unwinds the helix of the feminine Western experience with Fibonacci-like grace and precision. A beautiful debut by this post-national poet.” - Monica Storss, poet; Storss Publicity“...it takes a command of language and a relentless eye to bleed an entire life into a book of poetry and that is what has been accomplished in Life Cycle.” -KMA Sullivan, publisher, YesYes Books"These Life Cycles... have born us to this world, given us our fight, and given us our name. Dena is who we are in every regard." - Beasley Barrenton, Editor/Bomb Shelter Maintenance: Dog On A Chain PressForthcoming June 2013 - Powells (online, brick&mortar), St. Johns Books (Portland) - Bookworm (China) - via Dog On A Chain Press - and more
author: Dena Rash Guzman
